user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space:
```c
static void
handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space (struct MHD_Connection *c,
                                     const char *chunk_size_line,
                                     size_t chunk_size_line_size)
{
  unsigned int err_code;

  if (NULL != chunk_size_line)
  {
    const char *semicol;
    /* Check for chunk extension */
    semicol = memchr (chunk_size_line, ';', chunk_size_line_size);
    if (NULL != semicol)
    { /* Chunk extension present. It could be removed without any loss of the
         details of the request. */
      transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                      MHD_HTTP_CONTENT_TOO_LARGE,
                                      ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_EXT_TOO_BIG);
    }
  }
  err_code = get_no_space_err_status_code (c,
                                           MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED,
                                           chunk_size_line,
                                           chunk_size_line_size);
  transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                  err_code,
                                  ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_TOO_BIG);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
err_code = get_no_space_err_status_code (c,
                                           MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED,
                                           chunk_size_line,
                                           chunk_size_line_size);
  transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                  err_code,
                                  ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_TOO_BIG);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated. The two statements are reachable: there is no return or goto in the preceding branch, so get_no_space_err_status_code and the subsequent transmit_error_response_static can execute in all control-flow paths. (Only if transmit_error_response_static were a non-returning function — e.g. declared noreturn or calling exit/longjmp — would the later code become unreachable; nothing in the fragment indicates that.)
